ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Intersection of thinkers in continental philosophy (e.g. Heidegger, Arendt, Foucault) and famous architects (e.g., Norbert Schultz, Jean Nouvel, Rem Koolhas, Peter Eisenman).

A comprehensive knowledge of the history of architectural and philosophical thought during the 20th century.
A general knowledge of further topics and recent developments in architectural theory and practice and developing trends in philosophical thought.
Insights into novel interdisciplinary intersections.
New skills in thinking and writing about complex problems.
New skills in combining different methodologies.
I was able to strengthen my ability to analyze both philosophical concepts and architectural forms while creating connections between the material.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: there's a lot of freedom and choice with the topics you want to write about. The workload isn't a lot before you start writing the final paper.
Weakness: the readings are very dense and sometimes they are not made clear during class, so there were times when the prof asked a very insightful question but no one understood the reading with sufficient depth to answer / carry on the discussion.
I can't see any real weaknesses to the course. The content is fascinating, and it's well-structured, well-taught, and well-assessed.

Prof Patro is an absolute gem of a professor. He puts a lot of time in making sure his students get the most out of this class.
Material is interesting, though know that some weeks/topics will inevitably not be as interesting as others.
A strength was the discussion leader approach and the course readings were incredibly interesting!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's a chill class where you come across many interesting thinkers, but I don't feel like I had something tangible to take away from most of the classes.
Yes. It's brilliantly structured and skilfully taught and is accessible to a variety of backgrounds and abilities.

Absolutely. The material is unique/interesting. The real selling point however is Patro. Goat professor.
If you're even the slightest bit interested in the class, please take it. You won't regret it.
Yes, I have actually already recommended it to another student.
